name: 1,1':4',1''-Terphenyl

The basic unit for comparison can be benzene, which has a melting point of -114.1 degrees Celsius. The introduction of two additional phenyl rings linked in a linear fashion significantly enhances the melting point due to the increase in molecular weight and rigidity of the structure.
